{"id":988039547,"question_id":695,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"1Â year","timestamp":1688669786,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"190 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/988039547/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Max Area of Island","memory":"16.4 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def maxAreaOfIsland(self, grid: list[list[int]]) -> int:\n      # Declare\n      max = 0\n      \n      # count area of an island\n      def bfs(i: int, j: int) -> int:\n        # declare\n        queue = deque()\n        queue.append((i, j))\n        area = 0\n        \n        # counts area of an island, uses bfs\n        while queue:\n          r, c = queue.popleft()\n          \n          # goes right, down, left, up\n          for x, y in [(r, c), (r, c-1), (r, c+1), (r+1, c), (r-1, c)]:\n            if x in range(len(grid)) and y in range(len(grid[i])) and grid[x][y] == 1:\n              queue.append((x, y))\n              area += 1\n              grid[x][y] = 2 # change to recognize as visited\n        \n        # return\n        return area\n      \n      # check which island has most area\n      for i in range(len(grid)):\n        for j in range(len(grid[i])):\n          # unvisited land\n          if grid[i][j] == 1:\n            count = bfs(i, j)\n            max = count if max < count else max\n      \n      # return \n      return max","compare_result":"","title_slug":"max-area-of-island","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
